subject: Cybersecurity
title: SQL Slammer: The Fastest Worm Ever
description: A 60-second lesson on SQL Slammer: The Fastest Worm Ever.

hook.text: On January 25, 2003, a 376-byte worm doubled its infections every 8.5 seconds.

buildup.text: SQL Slammer exploited a known Microsoft SQL Server flaw. It infected 75,000 servers in 10 minutes.

discovery.text: The worm fit in a single UDP packet. It had no payload â€” just pure, exponential replication.

twist.text: The patch had been available for 6 months. Every infected server was vulnerable only because nobody updated.

climax.text: Slammer proved the most dangerous vulnerability is the one you already know about but haven't fixed.

quiz.question: How fast did SQL Slammer double its infections?
